name: Computer Science Principles
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: Satisfaction of the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement
description: Capabilities and applications of computers. Algorithmic problem-solving methods and computer programming. Using computers to examine questions from other fields of study. Practical and theoretical limits to computation. Machine intelligence and heuristic problem solving. Social and legal impact of computers

name: Introductory Computer Programming
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: Credit or concurrent registration in CS 150L
restrictions: Not open to students with credit in CS 107.
description: Computing methodology, process, and computational problem solving. Algorithm Design; program design, development, and testing

name: Introductory Computer Programming Laboratory
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Three hours of laboratory.
prereqs: Credit or concurrent registration in CS 150
description: Programming experiences designed to demonstrate and reinforce concepts through active experimentation and programming exercises

name: Intermediate Computer Programming
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: CS 150 and credit or concurrent registration in CS 160L
restrictions: Not open to students with credit in CS 108.
description: Advanced computing methodology, process, and computational problem solving. Programming environment and data structures. Object-oriented program design and development. Binary trees, linear lists, maps, queues, recursion, stacks

name: Intermediate Computer Programming Laboratory
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Three hours of laboratory.
prereqs: CS 150 and credit or concurrent registration in CS 160
description: Programming experiences designed to demonstrate and reinforce concepts through active experimentation and programming exercises

name: Introduction to Data Science and Python
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Basic data analysis with Python to include confidence intervals, regression, and sampling. Data structures, displaying data, and programming constructs.
description: The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Basic data analysis with Python to include confidence intervals, regression, and sampling. Data structures, displaying data, and programming constructs.
notes: Not open to Computer Science majors.

name: Data Structures
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Representations and operations on basic data structures. Arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, and recursion; binary search trees and balanced trees; hash tables, dynamic storage management; introduction to graphs. An object oriented programming language will be used. Formerly numbered: CS 310

name: Computer Organization
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: Credit or concurrent registration in CS 160
restrictions: Not open to students with credit in CS 237.
description: Organization and assembly language to include CPU, logic circuits, and memory. Data representation, interrupts, looping and addressing techniques, macros, and traps

name: Introduction to Software Systems
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Alternatives analyses, information management, networking and communications, parallel and distributed processing, principles and practices, security and encryption. Ethical, legal, and social issues in computing. Modeling will be used to capture and explore designs

name: Experimental Topics
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Selected topics.
notes: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor's degree.

name: Special Study
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Individual study

name: Computers and Society
general_education: GE Explorations Phys, Bio, Math/Quant Reasoning [UD 2/5]
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: Completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning II
description: A. , Natural Sciences and Quantitative Reasoning. Junior or Senior Standing. Impact of computers and computing technology on society: applications, benefits, and risks. Topics include privacy, copyright, computer crime, constitutional issues, risks of computer failures, evaluating reliability of computer models, computers in the workplace, trade and communications in the global village
notes: Not open to computer science majors or to students with credit in CS 440 .

name: Data Structures for Scientists and Engineers
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: CS 107 or CS 150 or consent of instructor
restrictions: Not open to Computer Science majors. Not open to students with credit in CS 210.
description: Program design and development. Object-oriented programming to include inheritance, polymorphism, and generic code. Representations and operations on basic data structures: arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, and trees

name: Programming Languages
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Principles of high-level programming languages, including formal techniques for syntax specification and implementation issues. Languages studied should include at least C++, FORTRAN, and LISP

name: Computer Architecture
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Logic gates, combinational circuits, sequential circuits, memory and bus system, control unit, CPU, exception processing, traps and interrupts, input-output and communication, reduced instruction set computers, use of simulators for analysis and design of computer circuits, and traps/interrupts

name: Advanced Programming Languages
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Concurrent programming, logic programming, object-oriented programming. Implementation issues. Formerly numbered: CS 520

name: Social, Legal, and Ethical Issues in Computing
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Impact of computers, applications, and benefits, copyright, privacy, computer crime, constitutional issues, risks of computer failures, evaluating reliability of computer models, trade and communications in the global village, computers in the workplace, responsibilities of the computer professional
notes: Not open to students with credit in CS 301 .

name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: First-order logic. Heuristic and uninformed search. Deep neural networks, hierarchical clustering, k-means, linear regression, support vector machines. Image classification and object tracking. Language models, parsing, speech generation. Formerly numbered: CS 550

name: Algorithms
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Algorithms for solving frequently occurring problems. Analysis techniques, divide and conquer algorithms with applications, graph problems, greedy algorithms. Introduction to NP complete problems. Formerly numbered: CS 560

name: UNIX System Administration
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Installing the UNIX operating system on a UNIX workstation, adding user accounts, backing up and restoring user files, installing windows, adding network capabilities, adding printers and other peripherals

name: Operating Systems
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: File system, I/O management, interprocess communication, memory management, processes and threads, program structures, thread synchronization, virtual memory. Formerly numbered: CS 570

name: Senior Seminar
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Two hours of activity.
prereqs: Fifteen units of upper division computer science courses
description: Preparation and delivery of oral presentations on advanced topics in computer science. General principles of organization and style appropriate for presenting such material

name: Experimental Topics
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Selected topics.
notes: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor's degree.

name: Undergraduate Research Seminar
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC One seminar and two meetings with adviser.
prereqs: CS 460 , or CS 480 , minimum grade point average of 3
description: 3, and consent of instructor. Designing and carrying out independent research in one of the areas of computer science. Literature search, technical report writing, and oral presentation of results

name: Undergraduate Honors Thesis
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Directed research in computer science and completion of honors thesis. Thesis to be presented at the annual SDSU Research Symposium and/or defended before a committee of faculty

name: Special Study
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Individual study

name: Scientific Database Techniques
grading_method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC)
description: Fundamental data models for handling scientific data, including flat file, indexed compressed files, relational databases, and object oriented databases, and their associated query technologies; e. g. file formats, input/output libraries, string searching, structured query language, object-oriented structured query language, hypertext markup language/common gateway interface, and other specialized interfaces. Designed for computational science students
notes: Computer science majors and minors must obtain adviser approval. See CS 514 . Not open to students with credit in CS 514.

name: Database Theory and Implementation
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Database systems architecture. Storage structures and access techniques. Relational model, relational algebra and calculus, normalization of relations, hierarchical and network models. Current database systems

name: Systems Programming
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Design and implementation of system software. Relationship between software design and machine architecture. Assemblers, compilers, debuggers, editors, linkers and loaders, macro processors. Object oriented concepts and programming fundamentals
notes: Not acceptable for the M.S. degree in computer science.

name: Software Engineering
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Theory and methodology of programming complex computer software. Analysis, design, and implementation of programs. Team projects required

name: Introduction to Web Application Development
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: World Wide Web application development. Client-side and server-side scripting, CSS, Javascript, PHP and CGI programming with Perl, XHTML. Application integration with SQL database systems

name: Machine Learning
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Algorithms and computer methods for machine learning. Supervised methods: convolutional neural networks, feedforward neural networks, linear regression, logistic regression, support vector machine; unsupervised methods: dimensionality reduction, k-means clustering, subspace learning. Applications in classification, regression and visualization

name: Neural Networks
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Computer algorithms and methods for neural networks. Convolutional networks, feedforward networks, generative adversarial networks, graphical neural networks, recurrent neural networks; backward propagation, computational graph, regularization, stochastic gradient descent; autoencoder networks and deep structure models

name: Robotics
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: CS 450 , MATH 254 , and familiarity with Matlab programming language
description: Robotic systems and their components. Spatial descriptions and transformations. Kinematics and inverse kinematics of robots. Robotic programming and simulation environments to include Matlab Robotics Toolbox. Mobile robots. Trajectory tracking and control. Path planning

name: Computer Simulation
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Methodology of simulation for discrete and continuous dynamic systems. State-of-the-art programming techniques and languages. Statistical aspects of simulation. Students will design, program, execute, and document a simulation of their choice

name: Computer Vision
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Algorithms and computer methods for processing of images, edge detection and filtering in spatial domain, FFT and filtering, frequency domain analysis of images, image compression, low level image processing, neighborhood operations, segmentation

name: Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing
grading_method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK)
description: Approaches on deep neural networks. Common tasks, modern programming frameworks, and state-of-the-art models

name: Automata Theory
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Definition of finite automata. Classification of finite automaton definable languages. Minimization of finite automata. Nondeterministic finite automata. Sequential machines with output. Regular sets and expressions. Introduction to grammars

name: Microprocessor Architecture
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: CS 370 and knowledge of the C programming language
description: Architecture of state-of-the-art microprocessor. Internal pipeline, internal cache, external cache, and memory management. Programming a uniprocessor. Communication among computers in a distributed environment. Architecture and programming of a multiprocessor system

name: Computer Security
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Principles of computer security and application of principles to operating systems, database systems, and computer networks. Topics include encryption techniques, access controls, and information flow controls

name: Network Traffic Analysis and Security
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: CS574 and CS576; or graduate standing or consent of the instructor Computer network security and privacy studied through network traffic analysis, passive and active measurement techniques, protocol analysis, and big data analytics
description: Covers defensive and offensive traffic analysis techniques within the Internet and Internet protocols

name: Computer Networks and Distributed Systems
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
prereqs: Credit or concurrent registration in CS 480
description: Basic networking concepts to include seven-layer reference model, transmission media, addressing, subnetting and supernetting, networking devices, LANs and WANs, internetworking, distributed processing, and client-server model. Basic concepts and protocols of TCP/IP protocol suite and basic Internet services

name: Principles and Techniques of Data Science
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Data classification, cleaning, common representation and operations, dimensionality reduction, hypothesis testing, life cycle, regression, statistical inference, and visualization

name: Wireless Networks
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Current and future protocols, fundamental theories, low power Internet of things and wireless sensor networks

name: Computational Linguistics
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: LING 581.
prereqs: CS 320 or CS 420 and LING 571 or LING 572 or BDA 572
description: Basic concepts in computational linguistics including finite-state transducers, n-gram language models, vector space semantics, statistical classifiers, neural nets, and transformers. Applications to parsing, natural language understanding, and large language models

name: Introduction to Speech Processing
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Fundamentals of speech processing and speech recognition. Physical aspects of speech production and perception. Mathematical models for speech recognition. Corpus development: data collection, processing, and evaluation. Applications of speech processing and associated research topics

name: 3D Game Programming
grading_method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC
description: Development of programming skills using software environment of a game engine and its scripting language. 3D concepts for game play, modeling, and programming. Roles needed in software development team. Contrast creation of original 3D object models for game world with incorporation of pre-created generic models

name: Advanced Topics in Computer Science
grading_method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC
description: Selected topics in computer science
notes: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor's degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master's degree with approval of the graduate adviser.
